setCodons

public void setCodons(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> newCodons,
                      int startIndex)
Sets each codon from the startIndex. If the number of codons takes the indexes beyond the length of the current codons then the new codons will be added to the end of the list of codons. However if the first index is greater than the length of the current set of codons then an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.

Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the first index is beyond the end of the current list of codons.

getCodons

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getCodons()
Note that modifying the returned list won't modify the GECandidateProgram's list of codons.
